alert.note: Alert for Aiken (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Aiken County through 730 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jackson, or 7 miles southeast of Clearwater. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Clearwater, Aiken Mall, Belvedere, New Ellenton, Jackson, Citizens Park, Gloverville, Burnettown, Audubon`s Silver Bluff Sanctuary, Savannah River Site Badge Office, Redcliffe Plantation State Historic Site, Boyd Pond Park and New Savannah Bluff Lock & Dam Park. This includes Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 17, and between mile markers 20 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
